column7: Jones Beach Island and Fire Island lie to the south. Babylon and North Babylon form the western border. Bay Shore lies to the east
column8: and in the north West Islip borders on Deer Park and Brentwood. West Islip is 45 miles (72 km) east of Manhattan and 45 miles (72 km) west of Southampton
column9: New York. West Islip's western boundary is a natural one formed by Sampawams Creek

column1: The first people to settle in this area more than one thousand years ago were the Secatogue Indians. The unearthing of an Indian burial ground north of West Islip beach enabled historians to reconstruct a village of these Indians who lived along the edges of the Great South Bay
column2: Sampawams Creek
the West Islip area came under the influence of the Dutch. In 1664 it came under English rule when the Duke of York claimed Long Island with the permission of King Charles II.

column1: In 1692 this land was purchased by Thomas and William Willetts through an agreement with the Secatogue Indians. These settlers found the area well suited for farming and hunting and the many waterways abundant with fish and shellfish. Since the Willetts owned most of West Islip
column2: additional families did not arrive until late in the 1770s when parcels of land were sold to others. The tax rolls of 1757 only listed Willetts.
the community became a popular haven of wealthy estate owners. Among these were the Magoun
column6: lumbering and fishing were the main occupations. In the mid-19th century
column7: the completion of the Long Island Rail Road brought travelers to West Islip and helped make the La Grange Inn a popular attraction. The inn had been established in the mid-18th century by the Higbie family.

column1: West Islip's population continued to grow slowly
column2: and the 1930 census recorded 734 residents. In the early part of the 20th century
column3: many Ukrainian people settled in West Islip seeking refuge from political repression and economic hardships. Some worked as gardeners on the estates while others became farmers
column4: land owners and owners of small businesses. The Ukrainian heritage is still part of the community.

column2: West Islip experienced most of its population growth. It had become an attractive suburban home community with its own fire department
column4: public library and Good Samaritan Hospital. A short drive on the Robert Moses Causeway affords access to good fishing at the Captree Boat Basin and swimming at Robert Moses State Park. West Islip boasts its own beach and marina.

column4: there are the Chamber of Commerce
column8: Youth Enrichment Services and the West Islip Fire Department. Every September the West Islip Bicentennial Committee sponsors a county fair.

column1: St. John the Baptist Diocesan High School [1]
Our Lady of Lourdes SchoolPublic libraries:
West Islip Public LibraryChildren living in West Islip attend grades K-5 in one of the district's four elementary schools
column2: and grades 6–8 in one of two middle schools. Elementary and middle schools in West Islip are assigned by demographics. Children in families living on the south side of the LIRR Babylon/Montauk branch tracks are assigned to either Bayview Elementary
column3: or Paul J. Bellew Elementary. Children who live on the north side of the tracks attend either Manetuck Elementary
column4: or Oquenock  Elementary School. In 2012 the school district closed two elementary schools; Kirdahy (Captree) Elementary School and Westbrook Elementary School. North side junior high school students attend Udall Road Middle School
column5: and those on the south side attend Beach Street Middle school. For high school all middle schoolers move up to West Islip High School (located at 1 Lions Path
column6: off of Higbie Lane) for 9th grade through 12th grade graduation.

column1: American Abstract Expressionist artist Robert Motherwell made many prints at ULAE located in West Islip.  He named one print "West Islip" in tribute to the locale and the print shop where the edition was pulled.
